results.title: Australian history
results.creator_credit: Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative, Bruce Petty and Petty Film Productions
results.brief_description: A film by cartoonist Bruce Petty using graphics and animation to present a satirical view of Australian history from early settlement to the present.

results.title: Australian gold rushes. - Years 7-10.
results.brief_description: Provides a general overview of the Australian gold rush period 1850-1900. It is presented in three segments: 1. “Discoveries”. - 2. “Gold rushes 1800-1900”. - 3. “Mining methods”. Consists of re-enactments, segments from early Australian feature films and stills from the period. This video would also be suitable for younger students.

results.title: Australian football: fitness, skill, sportsmanship
results.creator_credit: Fulton Muir, Jack Hamilton, Bruce Andrew, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Depicts important points of play in Australian Football and the need for fitness and training; excerpts from the 1969 Victorian Grand Final and the Interstate Football Carnival in Adelaide in 1969. Commentary by Brian Naylor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fulton Muir, Jack Hamilton, Bruce Andrew, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions

results.title: Australian football
results.creator_credit: Stanley Moore, Coca-Cola and Ajax Films
results.brief_description: The great Australian game of football - of colorful crowds packing Melbourne Cricket Ground to watch their idols play. Players demonstrate the bounce, recovery, centre bounce, tackling, passing the ball, marking, various types of kick and the finer points of the game to youngsters at school. Includes sequences shot whilst important games were in progress.

results.title: Australian football
results.creator_credit: Bruce Andrew, Australian Football Council and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: This film explains and demonstrates the following Australian rules terms: drop kick, punt kick, stab kick, place kick, highmarking, chest marking, hand ball, turning and baulking, tackling, ruck play, shepherding and blocking. Commentary by Eric Welch.

results.title: Australian food parade
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film surveys in part Australia’s fruit and cattle industries and indicates their potentialities. There are scenes from the Royal Agricultural Society’s Easter Show in Sydney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Australian Fibreboard Container
results.brief_description: A film commissioned by the Australian Fibreboard Manufacturers Association and APM to develop and promote cardboard box use. Depicts the logging of eucalypts, log processing, pulping and drying of paper, as well as paper recycling, cardboard processing, different tests for strength and the role of cardboard in packaging.
